Compensation_Benchmark_DefaultObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Compensation_Benchmark_DefaultObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Compensation_Benchmark_DefaultObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Benchmark_Job_Data.description: Use this field to effective date your composite market data.  If you "age" your survey data you will use this date to load in the new effective date with the updated amounts.
Inactive status indicator for Benchmark Job.
The name of the benchmark job.

validation.validation: The Benchmark Job name provided has already been used.
validation.description: The Benchmark Job name provided has already been used.

validation.validation: The Benchmark Job name is required.
validation.description: The Benchmark Job name is required.

Benchmark_Job_Data.description: This field is for informational purposes and represents the date specified by the provider for submitting data.  This date is often displayed as the effective date of the report. For example, you may load market data as of 1/1/2010 but the survey data is based on 11/1/2009.
Enter a description of the Benchmark Job. You can define a summary of the skills required for the Benchmark Job.

Job_ProfileObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Job_ProfileObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Job_ProfileObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Benchmark_Job_Data.description: Map Workday Job Profiles to the Benchmark Job.  The system will present an error message when the spreadsheet is loaded if one or more Job Profiles is mapped to another Benchmark Job.

validation.validation: One or more job profiles entered is mapped to another Benchmark Job. You must remove the job profile to save your changes.
Job profile is a required field.  You must enter at least one job profile for the Benchmark Job.
validation.description: Job profile is a required field.  You must enter at least one job profile for the Benchmark Job.

CurrencyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Benchmark_Job_Data.description: This value will be applied to the Base Pay Composite and Total Cash Composite categories.

Benchmark_Job_Data.description: This value will be applied to the Base Pay Composite and Total Cash Composite categories.

Benchmark_Job_Composite_Data.description: If True, the Benchmark Composite with the matching Category provided will be removed.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Benchmark_Job_Composite_Data.description: Valid options are "Base Pay Composite" or "Total Cash Composite".

Compensation_Benchmark_PercentileObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Compensation_Benchmark_PercentileObjectI.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Compensation_Benchmark_PercentileObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Benchmark_Job_Composite_Data.description: The value entered is what the system will consider your market target.   For example, the Competitive Market Target is defined as the 50th percentile and the base salary for the 50th is defined as 45,000. If the Target Spread is 10%, any employee whose base salary is between 42,550 - 47,250 will be considered At Market for this Benchmark Job.

validation.validation: Select 1 of the category [category] percentiles for the Competitive Market Target: [percentiles].

Benchmark_Job_Composite_Data.description: The value entered is used to define what the range is for an employee to be considered At Market. The value entered will be applied to define the bottom and top of the range. For example, the Competitive Market Target is defined as the 50th percentile and the base salary for the 50th is defined as 45,000. If the Target Spread is 10%, any employee whose base salary is between 42,750 - 47,250 will be considered At Market for this Benchmark Job.

validation.validation: Enter a Target Spread % for [composite] that isn't greater than 100%.

Compensation_Benchmark_PercentileObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Compensation_Benchmark_Amount_Replacment.description: Valid options include 5th to 95th percentile, in increments of 5's. For example, 5th, 10th, 15th, 20th, 25th, etc.
The base salary amount that maps to a Benchmark Percentile.

validation.validation: There are duplicate benchmark percentiles for this Benchmark Job.  Please remove duplicate benchmark percentiles to save your changes.
